text: The Potter and the Clay
The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, ⸤saying⸥,\f + \fr 18:1 \ft Literally “to say” \f*
“Stand up and go down \add to\add* the house of the potter, and there I will let you hear my words.”
So I went down \add to\add* the house of the potter and look, there he was doing work at the potter’s wheels.

And the vessel that he \add was\add* making with the clay was spoiled in the hand of the potter, so ⸤he made again⸥\f + \fr 18:4 \ft Literally “he turned back and he made it” \f* another vessel, as it was right in the eyes of the potter to make.
And the word of Yahweh came to me, ⸤saying⸥,\f + \fr 18:5 \ft Literally “to say” \f*

“Like this potter, am I not able to do to you, O house of Israel?” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 18:6 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh. “Look, like the clay in the hand of the potter, so \add are\add* you in my hand, O house of Israel.

One moment I speak concerning a nation or concerning a kingdom, to uproot, and to tear down, and to destroy \add it\add*.\f + \fr 18:7 \ft Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation \f*
But \add if\add* that nation turns back from its evil that I have threatened against it, then I will relent concerning the disaster that I planned to do to it.

And the \add next\add* moment I speak concerning a nation or concerning a kingdom, to build, and to plant \add it\add*.\f + \fr 18:9 \ft Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation \f*
But \add if\add* it does evil in my sight, to not listen to my voice, then I will relent concerning the good that I said I would do \add to\add* it.

“So now then, say, please, to the ⸤people⸥\f + \fr 18:11 \ft Literally “man” \f* of Judah and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, ⸤saying⸥,\f + \fr 18:11 \ft Literally “to say” \f* ‘Thus says Yahweh, “Look, I \add am\add* preparing evil against you, and \add I am\add* planning a plan against you. Please turn back, each one from his evil way, and walk rightly \add in\add* your ways and your deeds.” ’
But they will say, ‘\add It is\add* hopeless, for we will go after our \add own\add* plans, and each one of us will act \add according to\add* the stubbornness of his evil heart.’
“Therefore thus says Yahweh,
‘Please ask among the nations, “Who has heard ⸤the like of this⸥?”\f + \fr 18:13 \ft Literally “like these” \f*
The virgin of Israel has done something very horrible.
Does the snow of Lebanon leave from \add the\add* crags\f + \fr 18:14 \ft Hebrew “crag” \f* of Sirion?
Or are \add the\add* cold waters flowing from distant mountains dried up?
But my people have forgotten me.
They make smoke offerings to the idols,\f + \fr 18:15 \ft Hebrew “idol” \f*
and they caused them to stumble in their ways, \add the\add* ancient ways,
to go \add into\add* ⸤bypaths⸥,\f + \fr 18:15 \ft Literally “paths of way” \f* not \add one that\add* is built up.
To make their land a horror,
\add an object of\add* whistling for eternity.
All \add who\add* pass by it will be appalled,
and he will shake his head.
Like the wind from the east
I will scatter them ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 18:17 \ft Literally “to the face of” \f* \add the\add* enemy.
I will show them \add my\add* back and not \add my\add* face
in the day of their disaster.’ ”
Jeremiah’s Imprecatory Prayer

Then they said, “Come and let us plan plans against Jeremiah, for instruction will not be lost from \add the\add* priest, nor advice from \add the\add* wise man, nor \add the\add* word from \add the\add* prophet. Come and ⸤let us bring charges against him⸥,\f + \fr 18:18 \ft Literally “let us strike him with the tongue” \f* and let us not listen attentively to any of his words.”
Listen attentively to me, \add O\add* Yahweh,
and listen to \add the\add* voice of my opponents.
Should good be repaid in place of evil?
Yet they have dug a pit for me.
Remember my standing ⸤before you⸥\f + \fr 18:20 \ft Literally “to the face of you” \f* to speak good for them,
to avert your wrath from them.
⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 18:21 \ft Literally “To thus” \f* give their children to the famine,
and hand them over to \add the\add* ⸤power⸥\f + \fr 18:21 \ft Literally “hand” \f* of \add the\add* sword,
and let their wives be bereaved and widows,
and let their men be killed by death,
their young men struck dead
\add by the\add* sword in the battle.
Let a cry for help be heard from their houses
when you suddenly bring upon them \add the\add* raiding band,
for they have dug a pit to catch me,
and they have fixed secretly a trap for my feet.
But you, \add O\add* Yahweh, you know
⸤all their plans of assassination against me⸥.\f + \fr 18:23 \ft Literally “all of their plan against me to the death” \f*
You must not make atonement for their iniquity,
and you must not cause their sin to be blotted out from ⸤before you⸥.\f + \fr 18:23 \ft Literally “to the face of you” \f*
But let them be overthrown ⸤before you⸥.\f + \fr 18:23 \ft Literally “to the face of you” \f*
Deal with them in the time of your anger.
